method.name: POST
method.id: MMFA configuration for a reverse proxy instance
method.doc: This RESTful web service is used to add MMFA specific configuration to an existing reverse proxy instance. The reverse proxy configuration file is modified, a new junction is configured, and ACLs are created on the policy server.

The following Advanced Access Control Advanced Configuration items are sourced for configuration:
Junction: sps.page.junctionMacro
Cookie: attributeCollection.cookieName

MMFA can be configured on two different reverse proxy instances in order to support separate channels for browser and mobile flows. If the 'channel' parameter is not specified in the request a single channel will be configured with changes resulting in the combination of the browser and mobile channels.

param.name: reuse_acls
param.doc: A flag to indicate that any existing ACLs with the same name should be reused. If they are not reused, they will be replaced. Default is false.

param.name: reuse_certs
param.doc: If the SSL certificate has already been saved, this flag indicates that the certificate should be reused instead of overwritten. Default is false.

param.name: channel
param.doc: Supports multi channel configuration, absence configures single channel. Valid channel values: browser, mobile.

param.name: create_scim_junction
param.doc: A flag to indicate if the SCIM junction should also be created. If true, will overwrite any existing junction at /scim. Default is false.
